## Annex C Risk Assessment Example {#annex-c-risk-assessment-example .oobe-Heading-2-Non-TOC}

<a id="_Toc38651564"></a><a id="_Toc66205901"></a>__![](data:image/png;base64,)SQL Managed Instance Service Summary__

"Managed instance is a new deployment option of Azure SQL Database,
providing near 100% compatibility with the latest SQL Server on-premises
(Enterprise Edition) Database Engine, providing a native virtual network
(VNet) implementation that addresses common security concerns, and a
business model favourable for on-premises SQL Server customers."[^1]

**Security Considerations**

Noted service strengths:

-   Managed Instances are a deployment option of the Azure SQL Database
    service which was in-scope of most recent Infosec Registered
    Assessors Program (IRAP) assessment performed by Shearwater (2019).

-   Available in all Australian datacentres (AU East, Southeast, Central
    and Central 2) (PROTECTED certified).

-   Native integration with Azure AD for authentication and
    authorisation.

-   SQL updates are managed as part of the service.

-   Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) provides protection for data at
    rest.

Identified weaknesses:

-   Microsoft retains a level of control to manage the platform.

-   Logging and auditing are configured separately from the deployment
    of the Managed Instance.

**Risk Summary prior to mitigation**

The overall risk of the service has been assessed as **Medium to High**.
A summary of the risks for this service are presented below.

+----+--------------------------+---------+--------------+-------------+
| 1. | 2.  **Risk Overview**    | 3.      | 4.  **C      | 5.          |
|    |                          | **Likel | onsequence** |  **Rating** |
| ** |                          | ihood** |              |             |
| Ri |                          |         |              |             |
| sk |                          |         |              |             |
| ** |                          |         |              |             |
+====+==========================+=========+==============+=============+
| 1  | A malicious actor is     | Likely  | Major        | **High**    |
|    | able to craft an SQL     |         |              |             |

**Recommended Mitigations**

Standard PerimetaÂ® for Azure mitigations are recommended for all Azure
services, for example enforcing Azure MFA for all Global Admins.

The following mitigations are recommended to reduce the risk of using
Azure SQL Database Managed Instances:

> Identify Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and other sensitive
> information and use this to design a supportive database structure and
> approach to protecting the data, with appropriate controls.
>
> Develop a plan for the use of Service Principals for application
> permissions, implementing the principle of least privilege.
>
> Define a service-specific Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) model to
> limit administrative permissions.
>
> Within all applications connecting to SQL databases validate user
> input client-side and sanitise inputs server-side to remove common SQL
> injection vectors. In addition, the use of parametrised stored
> procedures can add another layer of security.
>
> Permit access to the database only from authorised applications and
> administrators, and only from within specified VNet.
>
> Modify the managed instance default provisioned Network Security Group
> (NSG) to only permit access from authorised applications, rather than
> the entire VNet.
>
> Leverage Microsoft of third-party SQL backup products to ensure
> verified backups of the databases are available.

**Risk Summary with mitigations**

The overall risk of the service has been assessed as **Low** to **Very
Low** with mitigations applied. A summary of the risks for this service
after mitigations are presented below.

+----+-------------------------+-----------------+-----------+---------+
| 6. | 7.  **Mitigation for    | 8.  **Treated   | 9.        | 10. **  |
|    |     risk**              |                 | **Treated | Treated |
| ** |                         |    Likelihood** |     Cons  |     R   |
| Ri |                         |                 | equence** | ating** |
| sk |                         |                 |           |         |
| ** |                         |                 |           |         |
+====+=========================+=================+===========+=========+
| 1  | Sanitise user input     | Unlikely        | Moderate  | **Low** |
|    | server-side             |                 |           |         |
|    |                         |                 |           |         |
|    | Use parametrised stored |                 |           |         |
|    | procedures              |                 |           |         |
|    |                         |                 |           |         |
|    | Restrict application    |                 |           |         |
|    | access to components of |                 |           |         |
|    | the database            |                 |           |         |
+----+-------------------------+-----------------+-----------+---------+
| 2  | Restrict network access | Very Unlikely   | Moderate  | **Low** |
|    | to the service,         |                 |           |         |
|    | including from internal |                 |           |         |
|    | devices                 |                 |           |         |
|    |                         |                 |           |         |

|    | permissions             |                 |           |         |

| 3  | Enable and test backup  | Very Unlikely   | Minor     | **Very  |
|    | services at regular     |                 |           | Low**   |
|    | intervals               |                 |           |         |
